intro: Zornia diphylla f. microphylla, commonly known as the small-leaved zornia, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is characterized by its small, oval-shaped leaves and produces small, pea-like flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. This plant is native to the southwestern United States and parts of Mexico, where it thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. It is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. The plant plays a role in soil stabilization and provides nectar for pollinators in its native habitat.
